TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XamlXmlReader extends System.Xaml.XamlReader implements class System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo
Public Class XamlXmlReader Inherits XamlReader Implements IXamlLineInfo
public ref class XamlXmlReader : System::Xaml::XamlReader, System::Xaml::IXamlLineInfo
type XamlXmlReader = class inherit XamlReader interface IXamlLineInfo

Docs.summary: Processes XAML markup from XML files by using an intermediary, and produces a XAML node stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you construct a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>, an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is required. The purpose of this design is to use established .NET Framework APIs for XML processing in order to handle stream input, to obtain a stream from a file, and so on.
<xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is the first component of the standard load path for XAML operations and is incorporated by <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> as well as by several existing framework XAML implementations for loading XAML.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HasLineInfo As Boolean
public: property bool HasLineInfo { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether line information is available.
Docs.value: if line information is available; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is part of the <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo> implementation. The result is partially based on the reader settings that were used to initialize this <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property IsEof As Boolean
public: virtual property bool IsEof { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that reports whether the reader position in the XAML node stream is at end-of-file.
Docs.value: if the position is at the conceptual end-of-file in the node stream; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you are currently using a subtree reader, the subtree reader reports <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.IsEof%2A> after exiting the bounds of the subtree. For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.ReadSubtree%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LineNumber As Integer
public: property int LineNumber { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the line number to report.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is part of the <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo> implementation. Node types of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartObject>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartMember>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.NamespaceDeclaration>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.Value> can return a line number. Other node types return a value of 0. All node types return 0 if <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.HasLineInfo%2A> is `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LinePosition As Integer
public: property int LinePosition { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the line position to report.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is part of the <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo> implementation. Node types of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartObject>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartMember>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.NamespaceDeclaration>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.Value> can return a line position. Other node types return a value of 0. All node types return 0 if <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.HasLineInfo%2A> is `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Member As XamlMember
public: virtual property System::Xaml::XamlMember ^ Member { System::Xaml::XamlMember ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the current member at the reader position, if the current reader position is on a .
Docs.value: The current member; or , if the current reader position is not on a member.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Namespace As NamespaceDeclaration
public: virtual property System::Xaml::NamespaceDeclaration ^ Namespace { System::Xaml::NamespaceDeclaration ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the XAML namespace from the current node.
Docs.value: The XAML namespace from the current node, if it is available; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property only has a non-null result if the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.NodeType%2A> of the current position is <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.NamespaceDeclaration>. This property does not report the XAML namespace that applies to objects or members in a general scoping sense. Your implementation should cache XAML namespace information if you need it for specific operations. For default operations that involve the loaded XAML schema context, the acting XAML namespace is internally cached by XAML writer implementations.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property NodeType As XamlNodeType
public: virtual property System::Xaml::XamlNodeType NodeType { System::Xaml::XamlNodeType get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the current node.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Read() cil managed
Public Overrides Function Read () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Provides the next XAML node from the loaded source, if a XAML node is available.
Docs.returns: if a node is available; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A node where <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.Read%2A> returns `false` also returns `true` for <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.IsEof%2A>.
Calling <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.Read%2A> generally has the side effect of advancing the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.LineNumber%2A> or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.LinePosition%2A>.
The next operation after calling <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.Read%2A> and getting a `true` result is typically to check <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.NodeType%2A>. For more information about XAML node stream concepts, see [Understanding XAML Node Stream Structures and Concepts](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/understanding-xaml-node-stream-structures-and-concepts.md).

Docs.related: Understanding XAML Node Stream Structures and Concepts

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property SchemaContext As XamlSchemaContext
public: virtual property System::Xaml::XamlSchemaContext ^ SchemaContext { System::Xaml::XamlSchemaContext ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an object that provides schema information for the information set.
Docs.value: An object that provides schema information for the information set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is either the default XAML schema context or a specifically derived XAML schema context that is provided as constructor information. Schema context affects many aspects of XAML processing behavior. In particular, the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.SchemaContext%2A> of the reader is generally used by any associated writer.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Type As XamlType
public: virtual property System::Xaml::XamlType ^ Type { System::Xaml::XamlType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the of the current node.
Docs.value: The of the current node; or , if the position is not on an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property only has a non-null result if the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.NodeType%2A> of the current position is <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartObject>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Value As Object
public: virtual property System::Object ^ Value { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the current node.
Docs.value: The value of the current node; or , if the position is not on a node type.
